title: Bug 129569HCGBIDI: Undesirable order of BiDI chars in Query window
description: Bug 129569HCGBIDI: Undesirable order of BiDI chars in Query window This is BiDI specific defect. tomer)3. tomerREMOT)4. Make sure that this table has columns with BiDi name (e.g. 'EMANNMULOC')5. from tomer.tomerREMOT3. where tomer.tomerREMOT.EMANNMULOC != 'OLLEH world'Actual results:1. select tomer.tomerEMANNMULOC.REMOT2. from tomer.tomerREMOT3. where tomer.tomerOLLEH' =!
OB: In the Query screen of the Edit Data Set dialog, the order of characters is disrupted in the query output. In the first row, the name of the column and part of the table name are switched. In the third row, part of the constant, table name, and column name are mixed up.
EB: The order of characters in the output query should not be disrupted. The name of the column, table name, and constants should be displayed correctly.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Open the Edit Data Set dialog
2. Navigate to the Query screen
3. Enter a query containing BiDi characters, such as 'select tomer.tomerEMANNMULOC.REMOT from tomer.tomerREMOT where tomer.tomerOLLEH != 'world'
